primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Cosmic Harvest: God sows good seed, allows growth alongside evil, and ultimately executes a definitive judgment and redemption through Christ to liberate creation.

tekstueel_bewijs: God would take hold of his creation in a definitive and final way
Jesus himself is the Lord of the final harvest
The last thing he could have imagined was that Jesus Christ would undergo the judgment himself.

object.identificatie: The redemption of creation and the 'harvest' of the children of God.
tekstueel_bewijs: the creation itself will be set free from its bondage to decay

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Promise of the Prophets
tekstueel_bewijs: promised by all the Hebrew prophets

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'mingled yarn' of humanity (sinners, prisoners, the groaning creation).
tekstueel_bewijs: even for prisoners and sinners like you and me

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Cross of Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: we ourselves, who have the first fruits of the Spirit
Jesus Christ would undergo the judgment himself
the power of death and its attendant sufferings
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an ontological 'Enemy' and a cosmic 'bondage to decay' that humans cannot solve.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to categorize and judge (the 'bookkeeping' of good vs. bad).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Humanity
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Moral certainty / Purity of the field
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human program of judging is exposed as a failure and is subsumed by God's primary program of patient grace and final judgment.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God would take hold of his creation
God was powerfully at work in him

voorbeelden: Christians seeking maturity have to spend our adult lives unlearning
longing for a key to unlock the doors
the creation waits with eager longing
I attempted to explain to her
we might not have known how to place the emphasis
the power of death... will be lifted
when human resources have come to an end

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God to act where human 'Savoir' and 'Devoir' fail. Salvation is an endowment of power to the powerless.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Naughty/Nice' list (~S1) to the reality of the 'Mingled Yarn' (~S2), then to the necessity of Judgment (S2), finally resolved by Christ taking the Judgment to give Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ as the 'Judge who was judged' resolves the tension between the necessity of rooting out evil and the desire to save the wheat.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; judgment is described as 'unquenchable fire' and a necessary 'separation'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects moralism ('making lists') and positions God as the sole actor capable of resolving the cosmic problem of evil.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Christians seeking maturity have to spend our adult lives unlearning...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The last thing he could have imagined was that Jesus Christ would undergo the judgment himself.
an apocalyptic battlefield... power of death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Chris Beker is used not as a moral example to follow, but as a 'road map of suffering' and an illustration of God's power working in human weakness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God works in the 'mingled yarn' of Beker's life.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; the burden of self-purification is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; God is the one who opens the 'heaven door'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the parable's warning with the Gospel's hope by centering on the person of the Judge.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ would undergo the judgment himself.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'first fruits' providing the 'Pouvoir' to hope amidst groaning.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'Enemy' that requires a divine harvest to remove.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains God as the Subject of all redemptive verbs. The hearer is correctly positioned as the 'field' or the 'receiver' of the harvest.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's harvest) precedes and enables the secondary program (human unlearning of judgment).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids the trap of turning the parable into a moralistic exhortation to 'be wheat' and instead focuses on the character of the Landowner.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the moving anecdotes of the granddaughter and Chris Beker, Greimasian analysis reveals these are actantial illustrations of human 'non-competence' vs. divine 'performance'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek word 'darnel'; Greimasian analysis focuses on the 'Enemy' as a necessary actant to prevent the sermon from becoming a simple story of human growth.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Subject-Switch' (Jesus taking the place of the Opponent/Judgment) is the engine that transforms a parable of threat into a sermon of grace.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Son of God (will make the distinction)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'mingled yarn' metaphor to collapse the Subject/Opponent distinction within the human actor, necessitating an external Subject (God) for resolution.
